page.title: 13OUR FARM IN HORTON
page.content: My Daddy keeps a dairy farm.At this time of year we are trying to make hay but at the moment it is raining too much. Daddy and Grampy milk the cows at six o'clock in the morning and at night.When the milk lorry comes the milk man writes a ticket to tell us how much milk. He knows what to write because he can read it on the dip- stick.Hay is kept in a barn.You make hay with a baler and sledge.We pick it up with a flat-eight. Sometimes I get up in the barn with Dad. We bring the hay into the barn with tractors and trailers.When the hay is high we use an elevator.In the Winter we give hay to the young cows. We go out on the tractor to give the calves some hay. Sometimes we find calves in ditches. A month ago we made a cow shed where we can put cows and hay in the Winter. Richard
